targets.description: By 2020, sustainably manage and protect marine and coastal ecosystems to avoid significant adverse impacts, and take action for their restoration in order to achieve healthy and productive oceans.
key_indicators: 14.2.1: Proportion of national exclusive economic zones managed using ecosystem-based approaches

targets.description: Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels.
key_indicators: 14.3.1: Average marine acidity (pH) measured at agreed suite of representative sampling stations

targets.description: By 2020, effectively regulate harvesting and end overfishing, illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and destructive fishing practices and implement science-based management plans.
key_indicators: 14.4.1: Proportion of fish stocks within biologically sustainable levels

targets.description: By 2020, conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information.
key_indicators: 14.5.1: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas

targets.description: By 2020, prohibit certain forms of fisheries subsidies which contribute to overcapacity and overfishing, and eliminate subsidies that contribute to illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.
key_indicators: 14.6.1: Degree of implementation of international instruments aiming to combat illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing

targets.description: By 2030, increase the economic benefits to Small Island developing States and least developed countries from the sustainable use of marine resources, including through sustainable management of fisheries, aquaculture and tourism.
key_indicators: 14.7.1: Sustainable fisheries as a proportion of GDP in small island developing States, least developed countries and all countries

targets.description: Increase scientific knowledge, develop research capacity and transfer marine technology, in order to improve ocean health and to enhance the contribution of marine biodiversity to the development of developing countries.
key_indicators: 14.a.1: Proportion of total research budget allocated to research in the field of marine technology

targets.description: Provide access for small-scale artisanal fishers to marine resources and markets.
key_indicators: 14.b.1: Degree of application of a legal/regulatory/policy/institutional framework which recognizes and protects access rights for small-scale fisheries

targets.description: Enhance the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources by implementing international law as reflected in UNCLOS.
key_indicators: 14.c.1: Number of countries making progress in ratifying, accepting and implementing ocean-related instruments

progress.global_progress_percentage: Less than 30% of targets on track
key_statistics: Over 17 million metric tons of plastic entered the ocean in 2021, projected to double or triple by 2040.
Only 8% of marine and coastal areas are under protection as of 2023.
More than one third (over 35%) of global fish stocks are overfished.
Ocean acidity has increased by 30% since the industrial revolution.
More than 3 billion people depend on marine and coastal biodiversity for their livelihoods.

challenges.challenge: Marine pollution from plastics and land-based sources
challenges.impact: Threatens marine life, food safety, and human health; damages coastal economies and ecosystems.

challenges.challenge: Overfishing and illegal, unreported and unregulated (IUU) fishing
challenges.impact: Depletes fish stocks, undermines food security, and threatens livelihoods of coastal communities.

challenges.challenge: Ocean acidification and climate change
challenges.impact: Reduces biodiversity, affects coral reefs, and disrupts marine food webs.

success_stories.initiative: Implementation of a comprehensive fisheries management system based on scientific quotas and strict enforcement.
success_stories.impact: Fish stocks have remained at sustainable levels, supporting both economic growth and ecosystem health.

success_stories.initiative: Establishment of large-scale marine protected areas, including the Nazca-Desventuradas Marine Park.
success_stories.impact: Over 40% of Chile's marine territory is now protected, preserving biodiversity and supporting sustainable fisheries.

success_stories.initiative: National Action Plan on Marine Plastic Debris aiming to reduce plastic waste by 70% by 2025.
success_stories.impact: Significant reductions in plastic leakage into the ocean, with improved waste management infrastructure.

priority_actions: Strengthen enforcement of regulations to combat illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.
Expand and effectively manage marine protected areas to cover at least 10% of marine and coastal areas.
Reduce marine pollution, especially plastics, through improved waste management and reduction of single-use plastics.
Promote sustainable fisheries and aquaculture practices.
Enhance scientific research and data collection on ocean health.
Increase international cooperation and capacity-building for developing countries.

interconnections.relationship: Sustainable fisheries support food security and nutrition for billions of people.
Oceans play a critical role in climate regulation and are impacted by climate change.
Reducing marine pollution requires sustainable production and consumption patterns.
Healthy oceans support livelihoods and economic growth, particularly for coastal communities.

targets.description: By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands.
key_indicators: 15.1.1: Forest area as a proportion of total land area
15.1.2: Proportion of important sites for terrestrial and freshwater biodiversity that are covered by protected areas

targets.description: By 2020, promote the implementation of sustainable management of all types of forests, halt deforestation, restore degraded forests and substantially increase afforestation and reforestation globally.
key_indicators: 15.2.1: Progress towards sustainable forest management

targets.description: By 2030, combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world.
key_indicators: 15.3.1: Proportion of land that is degraded over total land area

targets.description: By 2030, ensure the conservation of mountain ecosystems, including their biodiversity, in order to enhance their capacity to provide benefits that are essential for sustainable development.
key_indicators: 15.4.1: Coverage by protected areas of important sites for mountain biodiversity
15.4.2: Mountain Green Cover Index

targets.description: Take urgent and significant action to reduce the degradation of natural habitats, halt the loss of biodiversity and, by 2020, protect and prevent the extinction of threatened species.
key_indicators: 15.5.1: Red List Index

targets.description: Promote fair and equitable sharing of the benefits arising from the utilization of genetic resources and promote appropriate access to such resources, as internationally agreed.
key_indicators: 15.6.1: Number of countries that have adopted legislative, administrative and policy frameworks to ensure fair and equitable sharing of benefits

targets.description: Take urgent action to end poaching and trafficking of protected species of flora and fauna and address both demand and supply of illegal wildlife products.
key_indicators: 15.7.1: Proportion of traded wildlife that was poached or illicitly trafficked

targets.description: By 2020, introduce measures to prevent the introduction and significantly reduce the impact of invasive alien species on land and water ecosystems and control or eradicate the priority species.
key_indicators: 15.8.1: Proportion of countries adopting relevant national legislation and adequately resourcing the prevention or control of invasive alien species

targets.description: By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts.
key_indicators: 15.9.1: Progress towards national targets established in accordance with Aichi Biodiversity Target 2

targets.description: Mobilize and significantly increase financial resources from all sources to conserve and sustainably use biodiversity and ecosystems.
key_indicators: 15.a.1: Official development assistance and public expenditure on conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity and ecosystems

targets.description: Mobilize significant resources from all sources and at all levels to finance sustainable forest management and provide adequate incentives to developing countries to advance such management, including for conservation and reforestation.
key_indicators: 15.b.1: Official development assistance and public expenditure on conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity and ecosystems

targets.description: Enhance global support for efforts to combat poaching and trafficking of protected species, including by increasing the capacity of local communities to pursue sustainable livelihood opportunities.
key_indicators: 15.c.1: Proportion of traded wildlife that was poached or illicitly trafficked

key_statistics: Between 2015 and 2022, global forest area declined by 100 million hectares.
One million animal and plant species are threatened with extinction.
Land degradation affects nearly 3.2 billion people worldwide.
Only 16% of terrestrial and 8% of freshwater key biodiversity areas are fully protected.

challenges.challenge: Deforestation and forest degradation due to agricultural expansion, logging, and infrastructure development.
challenges.impact: Loss of biodiversity, disruption of ecosystem services, and increased greenhouse gas emissions.

challenges.challenge: Illegal wildlife trade and poaching.
challenges.impact: Decline in populations of threatened species and destabilization of ecosystems.

challenges.challenge: Spread of invasive alien species.
challenges.impact: Displacement of native species, alteration of habitats, and economic losses.

challenges.challenge: Insufficient financial resources and weak governance frameworks.
challenges.impact: Limited capacity to implement conservation measures and enforce regulations.

success_stories.initiative: Implementation of Payment for Ecosystem Services (PES) programs to incentivize forest conservation and restoration.
success_stories.impact: Forest cover increased from 21% in the 1980s to over 53% by 2022.

success_stories.initiative: Large-scale reforestation and afforestation projects under the Grain for Green Program.
success_stories.impact: Restoration of over 30 million hectares of degraded land and increased forest cover to 23.04% by 2022.

success_stories.initiative: National efforts to restore degraded land through agroforestry and community engagement.
success_stories.impact: Restoration of over 700,000 hectares and improved livelihoods for rural communities.

priority_actions: Strengthen and enforce legal frameworks to prevent deforestation and land degradation.
Increase investment in ecosystem restoration and sustainable land management.
Enhance support for local and indigenous communities in conservation efforts.
Expand and effectively manage protected areas for terrestrial and freshwater biodiversity.
Combat illegal wildlife trade through international cooperation and capacity building.
Integrate biodiversity values into national planning and economic decision-making.

interconnections.relationship: Sustainable land management supports food security and resilient agricultural systems.
Healthy terrestrial ecosystems regulate water cycles and maintain water quality.
Forests and land ecosystems are critical carbon sinks, helping mitigate climate change.
Land-based activities impact coastal and marine ecosystems through runoff and pollution.

targets.description: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
key_indicators: 16.1.1: Number of victims of intentional homicide per 100,000 population, by sex and age
16.1.4: Proportion of population that feel safe walking alone around the area they live

targets.description: End abuse, exploitation, trafficking and all forms of violence against and torture of children
key_indicators: 16.2.1: Proportion of children aged 1–17 years who experienced any physical punishment and/or psychological aggression by caregivers in the past month
16.2.2: Number of victims of human trafficking per 100,000 population

targets.description: Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all
key_indicators: 16.3.1: Proportion of victims of violence in the previous 12 months who reported their victimization to competent authorities or other officially recognized conflict resolution mechanisms
16.3.2: Unsentenced detainees as a proportion of overall prison population

targets.description: By 2030, significantly reduce illicit financial and arms flows, strengthen the recovery and return of stolen assets and combat all forms of organized crime
key_indicators: 16.4.1: Total value of inward and outward illicit financial flows (in current US dollars)
16.4.2: Proportion of seized, found or surrendered arms whose illicit origin or context has been traced or established by a competent authority

targets.description: Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms
key_indicators: 16.5.1: Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe, during the previous 12 months
16.5.2: Proportion of businesses that had at least one contact with a public official and that paid a bribe or were asked for a bribe during the previous 12 months

targets.description: Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels
key_indicators: 16.6.1: Primary government expenditures as a proportion of original approved budget, by sector (or by budget codes or similar)
16.6.2: Proportion of population satisfied with their last experience of public services

targets.description: Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels
key_indicators: 16.7.1: Proportions of positions (by sex, age, persons with disabilities and population groups) in public institutions compared to national distributions
16.7.2: Proportion of population who believe decision-making is inclusive and responsive, by sex, age, disability and population group

targets.description: Broaden and strengthen the participation of developing countries in the institutions of global governance
key_indicators: 16.8.1: Proportion of members and voting rights of developing countries in international organizations

targets.description: By 2030, provide legal identity for all, including birth registration
key_indicators: 16.9.1: Proportion of children under 5 years of age whose births have been registered with a civil authority, by age

targets.description: Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements
key_indicators: 16.10.1: Number of verified cases of killing, kidnapping, enforced disappearance, arbitrary detention and torture of journalists, associated media personnel, trade unionists and human rights advocates
16.10.2: Number of countries that adopt and implement constitutional, statutory and/or policy guarantees for public access to information

targets.description: Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime
key_indicators: 16.a.1: Existence of independent national human rights institutions in compliance with the Paris Principles

targets.description: Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development
key_indicators: 16.b.1: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law

progress.global_progress_percentage: Less than 20% of targets on track
key_statistics: In 2022, the global homicide rate was 5.8 per 100,000 population, with the highest rates in Latin America and the Caribbean and Sub-Saharan Africa.
One in six children globally experienced some form of violence in the past year.
Only 73% of children under age 5 worldwide had their births registered in 2022.
Over 80 million people were forcibly displaced by conflict and violence as of 2023.
Corruption remains widespread, with 1 in 4 people worldwide reporting having paid a bribe in the previous year.

challenges.challenge: Rising violent conflict and insecurity
challenges.impact: Undermines development, increases displacement, and causes loss of life and livelihoods.

challenges.challenge: Prevalence of corruption and weak institutions
challenges.impact: Erodes trust in government, limits access to justice, and hampers economic growth.

challenges.challenge: Limited access to justice and legal identity
challenges.impact: Marginalizes vulnerable populations, especially women and children, and restricts access to services and rights.

challenges.challenge: Threats to fundamental freedoms and safety of journalists
challenges.impact: Restricts civic space, limits freedom of expression, and endangers human rights defenders.

success_stories.initiative: Establishment of an independent anti-corruption authority and implementation of open government reforms.
success_stories.impact: Improved Transparency International Corruption Perceptions Index score by 8 points between 2012 and 2022.

success_stories.initiative: Nationwide campaign to increase birth registration and legal identity for children.
success_stories.impact: Birth registration coverage increased from 76% in 2017 to 92% in 2022.

success_stories.initiative: Judicial reforms to enhance independence and accountability of the judiciary.
success_stories.impact: Increased public trust in the judiciary from 23% in 2013 to 45% in 2021.

priority_actions: Strengthen the rule of law and ensure equal access to justice for all
Increase investment in effective, accountable and transparent institutions
Enhance protection of fundamental freedoms and civic space
Accelerate efforts to end violence, especially against children and vulnerable groups
Combat corruption and illicit financial flows
Promote legal identity and birth registration for all
Support inclusive and participatory decision-making at all levels

interconnections.relationship: Peaceful and inclusive societies are essential for poverty eradication.
Access to justice and legal identity support inclusive and equitable quality education.
Strong institutions are necessary to protect women and girls from violence and discrimination.
Reducing inequality requires fair and inclusive institutions.
Global partnerships and strong institutions are mutually reinforcing for sustainable development.

targets.description: Strengthen domestic resource mobilization, including through international support to developing countries, to improve domestic capacity for tax and other revenue collection.
key_indicators: 17.1.1 Total government revenue as a proportion of GDP, by source
17.1.2 Proportion of domestic budget funded by domestic taxes

targets.description: Developed countries to implement fully their official development assistance commitments.
key_indicators: 17.2.1 Net official development assistance, total and to least developed countries, as a proportion of the OECD Development Assistance Committee donors’ gross national income

targets.description: Mobilize additional financial resources for developing countries from multiple sources.
key_indicators: 17.3.1 Foreign direct investments (FDI), official development assistance and South-South Cooperation as a proportion of total domestic budget
17.3.2 Volume of remittances (in United States dollars) as a proportion of total GDP

targets.description: Assist developing countries in attaining long-term debt sustainability.
key_indicators: 17.4.1 Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services

targets.description: Adopt and implement investment promotion regimes for least developed countries.
key_indicators: 17.5.1 Number of countries that adopt and implement investment promotion regimes for least developed countries

targets.description: Enhance North-South, South-South and triangular regional and international cooperation on and access to science, technology and innovation.
key_indicators: 17.6.1 Number of science and/or technology cooperation agreements and programmes between countries

targets.description: Promote the development, transfer, dissemination and diffusion of environmentally sound technologies to developing countries.
key_indicators: 17.7.1 Total amount of approved funding for developing countries to promote the development, transfer, dissemination and diffusion of environmentally sound technologies

targets.description: Fully operationalize the technology bank and science, technology and innovation capacity-building mechanism for least developed countries.
key_indicators: 17.8.1 Proportion of individuals using the Internet

targets.description: Enhance international support for implementing effective and targeted capacity-building in developing countries.
key_indicators: 17.9.1 Dollar value of financial and technical assistance committed to developing countries

targets.description: Promote a universal, rules-based, open, non-discriminatory and equitable multilateral trading system under the WTO.
key_indicators: 17.10.1 Worldwide weighted tariff-average

targets.description: Significantly increase the exports of developing countries, in particular with a view to doubling the least developed countries’ share of global exports by 2020.
key_indicators: 17.11.1 Developing countries’ and least developed countries’ share of global exports

targets.description: Realize timely implementation of duty-free and quota-free market access for least developed countries.
key_indicators: 17.12.1 Average tariffs faced by developing countries, least developed countries and small island developing States

targets.description: Enhance global macroeconomic stability, including through policy coordination and policy coherence.
key_indicators: 17.13.1 Macroeconomic Dashboard

targets.description: Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development.
key_indicators: 17.14.1 Number of countries with mechanisms in place to enhance policy coherence of sustainable development

targets.description: Respect each country’s policy space and leadership to establish and implement policies for poverty eradication and sustainable development.
key_indicators: 17.15.1 Extent of use of country-owned results frameworks and planning tools by providers of development cooperation

targets.description: Enhance the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development, complemented by multi-stakeholder partnerships.
key_indicators: 17.16.1 Number of countries reporting progress in multi-stakeholder development effectiveness monitoring frameworks

targets.description: Encourage and promote effective public, public-private and civil society partnerships.
key_indicators: 17.17.1 Amount of United States dollars committed to public-private and civil society partnerships

targets.description: Enhance capacity-building support to developing countries to increase the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data.
key_indicators: 17.18.1 Proportion of sustainable development indicators produced at the national level
17.18.2 Number of countries with a national statistical plan

targets.description: Build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development.
key_indicators: 17.19.1 Dollar value of all resources made available to strengthen statistical capacity
17.19.2 Proportion of countries that have conducted at least one population and housing census in the last 10 years

progress.global_progress_percentage: Less than 50% of targets on track
key_statistics: Official development assistance (ODA) fell by 0.7% in 2022 compared to 2021, reaching $204 billion.
Least developed countries received only 0.33% of donor GNI as ODA in 2022, below the 0.7% target.
Global FDI flows decreased by 12% in 2022, with developing countries most affected.
Remittances to low- and middle-income countries reached $626 billion in 2022, a 5% increase from 2021.
Only 56% of countries have national statistical plans for SDG monitoring.

challenges.challenge: Declining official development assistance and limited financial flows to developing countries.
challenges.impact: Restricts the ability of developing countries to finance essential services and invest in sustainable development.

challenges.challenge: Insufficient data and statistical capacity for SDG monitoring.
challenges.impact: Hampers evidence-based policymaking and tracking of SDG progress.

challenges.challenge: Limited access to technology and innovation for developing countries.
challenges.impact: Slows progress on multiple SDGs and widens the digital divide.

success_stories.initiative: The a2i (Access to Information) Programme, a government-led digital transformation initiative, expanded digital services and e-governance through multi-stakeholder partnerships.
success_stories.impact: Over 100 million citizens accessed digital services, improving efficiency and transparency in public service delivery.

success_stories.initiative: Smart Africa Alliance, a partnership of African countries and private sector to accelerate sustainable socio-economic development through ICT.
success_stories.impact: Increased internet penetration from 26% in 2017 to over 60% in 2022, fostering innovation and entrepreneurship.

success_stories.initiative: Norad’s support for capacity-building in national statistical systems in Sub-Saharan Africa.
success_stories.impact: Improved data quality and availability for SDG monitoring in 10 African countries.

priority_actions: Increase official development assistance and fulfill international commitments to developing countries.
Strengthen national statistical systems and data collection for SDG monitoring.
Promote technology transfer and innovation partnerships for sustainable development.
Enhance multi-stakeholder and public-private partnerships at all levels.
Support debt sustainability and financial resource mobilization for vulnerable countries.

interconnections.relationship: Partnerships mobilize resources and expertise needed to eradicate poverty.
Global health initiatives rely on international cooperation and funding partnerships.
Technology transfer and innovation partnerships are essential for building resilient infrastructure.
Climate action requires coordinated global partnerships and finance.
Strong institutions and policy coherence are supported by effective partnerships.
